turn.0: ELI5: What is the "Q" doing in "LGBTQIA+"? Isn't "queer" already an umbrella term for all the other letters?
turn.1: There are many sports that fall outside of football, basketball, and baseball.  Just as there are possibly those who identify as just queer but not the other identifiers.  By including Q those who identify that way are given representation and not ignored.
turn.2: But then it would be more appropiate to call it "Queer" instead of "LGBTQIA+".  Thats what I meant with this comparison. There is no need to name something "Football, Basketball, Sports, and Baseball" when it means the exact same thing as just "Sports".
turn.3: Not everyone identifies as queer.  It’s about representation.
turn.4: Uh, wait a minute. This is the first sentence about "Queer" on Wikipedia:  > ***Queer*** is an [umbrella term](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Umbrella_term) for [sexual](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_minority) and [gender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gender) [minorities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minority_group) who are not [heterosexual](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heterosexual) or are not [cisgender](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cisgender).   Under that definition, it is impossible to be, for example, "gay but not queer".  Unless everyone has a different idea what the word "queer" actually means. But I do hope that such a widely-used acronym actually means something.
turn.5: That’s a fairly old view on it.
